Desc.entry: A registered charity and voluntary organisation which provides practical and organisational advice, support and training to individuals and groups who are looking to get involved in environmental work. A midweek conservation group is run every Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday, which carries out practical conservation work within the South Yorkshire area. Task days include a variety of work, ranging from tree felling to dry stone walling, and caters for all abilities and ages (under 18's require parental consent). Also encourages volunteers currently experiencing mental health distress to attend task days through the Wellbeing Comes Naturally programme. All tools, training and transport to the site provided. Volunteers need to provide a packed lunch and steel toe-capped boots. Booking essential.

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm (office times). Task days tues, wed & thurs,please contact for times and to book a place
